definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...

sentences.english: And he laughs while he does it, he always added, scowling at his son.
sentences.chinese: 他總是加上這麼一句，並對他的兒子怒目相向。

sentences.english: In disagreements, fight fairly. Please No name calling.
sentences.chinese: 意見相左時，不要怒目相向，也不要指名道姓爭吵。

definition: lit. furrowed brows and blazing eyes/to dart looks of hate at sb (idiom)
to scowl and stare down/to defy
scowling in anger/rage written across one's face
to suddenly change color showing displeasure, bewilderment etc
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
see 惱羞成怒|恼羞成怒[nao3 xiu1 cheng2 nu4]
to turn a blind eye to
